text: The shitty part of town... down by the docks. Rows of boarded-up old buildings line a pot-holed street. And this world is silent as we drift along the center of the empty pavement... move tight on one of those puddle-filled mini-craters... close enough to see the skyвЂ™s cloudy reflection in the milky water ItвЂ™s all so peaceful... ...until a SMALL, BARE FOOT SPLASHES INTO THE PUDDLE. And then we see who the foot belongs to... ...a LITTLE GIRL, (LUCIE), (10), wearing just a stained, tattered gown... her bruised, terrified face lined with tear-streaks through the filth... her mouth open wide, like sheвЂ™s screaming but nothing will come out. And Christ, sheвЂ™s running fast... as fast as her little body will take her... those bare feet SMACKING THE PAVEMENT as she throws frantic glances over her shoulder... ...but the street behind her is empty... ...S0 she just keeps running toward us... like weвЂ™re the only people in the world that might be able to save her. And as she nears, her SCREAM FINALLY ERUPTS... a painful, horrifying cry. And EVERYTHING GOES BLACK... ...Stays that way as LucieвЂ™s SCREAM ECHOES OVER US... finally fading... ...as small circles of light begin to sweep across the dark screen, and we find ourselves...

Dark and shadowy, except for the POLICE FLASHLIGHTS floating over the scene.  COPS move around a deserted building... rusty pipes along the ceilings... rats scurrying across the floor... every room is empty. A COP stops beside our lead DETECTIVE. CoP We sure this is the right building? The Detective nods... scans the room.
ItвЂ™s the one the girl pointed out. CoP Whoever was in here, they sure didnвЂ™t leave any scraps. ANOTHER COP leans into the room.

Nothing upstairs. Cop #2 walks back out. CoP Maybe she was just too scared... pointed at the wrong one. The Detective steps out into a long, dark hall... it looks creepy as hell, but no different than any other decayed old corridor. His eyes follow the trail of his flashlight beam over the empty floor.
Yeah... maybe.

EXT. SAINT MARYвЂ™S ORPHANAGE - DAY An old compound. DOZENS OF CHILDREN run around a playground... swinging... sliding... climbing. These are the lost children of Baltimore... abandoned... abused... forgotten. None of them will leave this place until theyвЂ™re old enough to walk out on their own... alone.  But right now, none of them seem to mind too much... theyвЂ™re laughing... having fun... ...except for one little girl... our Lucie... sitting on a tree stump, her back to the others. SheвЂ™s staring out into the distance... maybe looking for whoever it is that might still be chasing her. Most of her bruises have all healed... at least the ones we can see. Then she looks down... to a SKETCH PAD ON HER LAP... a half-finished crayon picture of a SMALL FIGURE

head_text.subj: SITTING IN A SINGLE CHAIR AT THE CENTER OF A SQUARE

text: What looks like it could be a SMALL BUCKET rests just beneath the chair. Lucie lifts a RED CRAYON... makes some marks around the floor... on the walls.

Hi. Lucie doesnвЂ™t acknowledge the voice... keeps making those red marks. So the voice kneels down beside the stump... a pretty little girl, ANNA, (10). SheвЂ™s holding two cookies... extends one of them out to Lucie. Lucie glances at it, then to Anna, before going back to her drawing. Anna rests the cookie on the stump beside Lucie... takes a bite of her own.

IвЂ™m Anna. Lucie doesnвЂ™t respond... like she didnвЂ™t even hear her. ANNA (contвЂ™d) YouвЂ™re Lucie, right? ThatвЂ™s what the Sisters said. Still nothing... just the scratching of that crayon on the paper. ANNA (contвЂ™d) Do you wanna play or something?  Even Anna knows she isnвЂ™t going to get an answer. But she still crouches there beside Lucie for a moment... giving her a chance before finally standing... ANNA (contвЂ™d) Bye. ...Walks away... doesnвЂ™t see behind her... Lucie stops drawing... lifts the cookie... takes a nibble as her eyes rise from the sketch pad... to whateverвЂ™s out there in the distance. INT. SAINT MARY'S ORPHANAGE/ANNAвЂ™S ROOM - NIGHT Just the dim glow of a hall light creeping through the open door. Anna lies in bed, staring at the ceiling... whispering.

I pray the Lord my soul to take. If I should... An 0.S. SCREAM interrupts AnnaвЂ™s prayer. A familiar scream. LucieвЂ™s scream. Anna looks to the hall... Two NUNS hurry past. Anna climbs out of bed... moves to the door, and peers out... watches them rush into a room.

ItвЂ™s okay, Lucie. ThereвЂ™s no one there. No oneвЂ™s going to hurt you. LucieвЂ™s CRYING floats down the hall to Anna, as she just stares at LucieвЂ™s dark doorway. EXT. SAINT MARYвЂ™S ORPHANAGE - DAY The playground. Just like before, Children running around... except for Lucie, back on her stump... not drawing this time... just gazing out... the sketch pad resting beside her... ...@ CHILDвЂ™S DRAWING OF A DARK FIGURE IN A DOORWAY on the open page. Anna walks up beside her, again holding two cookies.

I sneak in the kitchen when Sister Rachel is doing her beads. Lucie doesnвЂ™t react. Anna starts to rest the cookie on the stump again, but this time Lucie reaches out... eases the cookie from AnnaвЂ™s hand. ANNA (contвЂ™d) TheyвЂ™re still warm. (beat ) You donвЂ™t have a family either, huh? Lucie just takes a bite of the cookie. Again, Anna waits for an answer she isnвЂ™t going to get. So she turns to leave... just as Lucie inches over on the stump... knocking her sketch pad to the ground. But now thereвЂ™s room for two. Anna smiles... drops down beside her... watches Lucie take another bite, then looks out into the distance... silently sharing LucieвЂ™s stare. And then we go to a... SERIES OF SHOTS...

head_text.subj: ANNA AND LUCIE CLIMBING A TREE... PULLING THEMSELVES

text: UP THROUGH THE BRANCHES UNTIL THEYвЂ™RE NEAR THE TOP... LOOKING DOWN ON THE KIDS AND NUNS BELOW.

head_text.subj: ANNA AND LUCIE RACE LAUGHING OUT OF THE ORPHANAGE
KITCHEN, EACH HOLDING SEVERAL COOKIES AS A NUN YELLS
ANNA AND LUCIE ON THE PLAYGROUND... TWIRLING ON THE
MERRY-GO-ROUND... LYING ON THEIR BACKS... WATCHING
IN THE CHAPEL... ALL THE CHILDREN KNEELING IN THE
PEWS... DEEP IN PRAYER. ANNA AND LUCIE SIDE BY
SIDE... ARMS INTERLOCKED... PALMS PRESSED TOGETHER...

text: EYES SQUEEZED SHUT... UNTIL ONE OF LUCIEвЂ™S EYES

head_text.subj: OPEN... TAKES A QUICK GLANCE AT ANNA... ALMOST LIKE

text: SHEвЂ™S MAKING SURE HER FRIEND IS STILL THERE WITH HER.

The Sisters say youвЂ™ve become good friends with Lucie.  INT. SAINT MARYвЂ™S ORPHANAGE/OFFICE - DAY Anna sits in a chair, as a couple NUNS stand nearby, and the Detective sits across from her. Anna looks nervous... manages a nod.
Does she ever say anything... about the people that hurt her?
No.
What kind of things does Lucie tell you, Anna? Anna looks to one of the Nuns. The Nun gives her a nod... itвЂ™s okay to tell him.
She talks about monsters a lot. She says theyвЂ™re still out there.
Monsters. Anna nods again. DETECTIVE (cont'd) Has Lucie ever told you what the monsters look like?

INT. SAINT MARY'S ORPHANAGE/LUCIEвЂ™S ROOM - NIGHT A FLICKERING NIGHTLIGHT casts a stuttering glow over the room. LucieвЂ™s in her nightgown, ready to climb into bed. But then she glances to the door... to the darkness that lies beyond. She slides a chair over... the metal legs SCREECHING across the tile floor. Lucie closes the door... props the chair against the handle, holding it shut. The nightlight FLICKERS... enough to shoot Lucie into motion... she charges to her bed...  leaps into the covers, pulling them up around her face. But at least she made it. And then that NIGHTLIGHT FLICKERS OFF. The ROOM GOES PITCH DARK. Lucie yanks the covers up over her face.

LUCIEвЂ™S POV UNDER THE COVERS... THE DARKNESS BLEEDING THROUGH THE SHEET. ALL WE CAN HEAR IS LUCIEвЂ™S FRANTIC BREATHING... ...until the NIGHTLIGHT FLASHES BACK ON. A glow returns above the sheet. Lucie lowers the sheet... looks to the night-light... full glow. And just as sheвЂ™s about to relax... ...she sees the door standing open... the chair slid back across the room. Someone moved it Lucie just stares in fear... doesnвЂ™t even realize sheвЂ™s stopped breathing.

head_text.subj: AND THEN A SHAPE DARTS THROUGH THE SHADOWS BESIDE

text: She spins... nothing there. But there was something, so Lucie ducks back under the covers again, and we go with her... ...Staring through that thin sheet, at the dim glow beyond. And just like before, the world is silent... not even LucieвЂ™s breathing this time. Then through the sheet, we see a SILHOUETTE RISE AT THE FOOT OF THE BED... no way to see who it is.

(whispers) Anna? No answer. Just that shadow standing over us. And Lucie closes her eyes... wants the shape to be gone when she opens them. But it isnвЂ™t. So she slowly pulls the sheet back... the room inches into dim view... ...until we see whatвЂ™s at the end of LucieвЂ™s bed... this horrible, disfigured CREATURE...  almost like the living corpse of a woman with long hair matted around her emaciated face. Lucie opens her mouth to scream, but just like the first time we saw her, nothing comes out... and the Creature leaps.

INT. SAINT MARY'S ORPHANAGE/ANNAвЂ™S ROOM - NIGHT Anna in bed. LucieвЂ™s SCREAM POURS OVER HER. Anna leaps from bed... charges out the door. INT. SAINT MARY'S ORPHANAGE/LUCIEвЂ™S ROOM - NIGHT Anna races into the room... turns on the light... the bedвЂ™s empty. The sheets are tossed about, scattered to the floor. Anna scans the room. Her eyes settle on the CLOSED CLOSET DOOR. She eases toward it... takes the handle... twists it open... ...and there inside the dark closet is Lucie... huddled on the floor, deep gashes torn into her arms. Lucie starts to scream again, but sees that itвЂ™s only Anna... so she holds out one of her bloody hands to her friend. Anna steps inside, closing the door behind her, then slides down to the floor, and pulls Lucie against her... holds her... like a mother comforting her frightened child.
ItвЂ™s okay. I wonвЂ™t let them hurt you anymore. As Anna holds Lucie...
Do you believe her?
INT. SAINT MARYвЂ™S ORPHANAGE/OFFICE - DAY Anna still sitting across from the Detective.

Do you believe the things Lucie tells you about her monsters? Anna stares back at the Detective a long beat... long enough for us to tighten on her face... to her tiny lips. Then in the softest of whispers.
I donвЂ™t know. And we SLAM TO BLACK... wait in the darkness as a WORD RISES FROM THE DARK. Our TITLE...
Then the word fades with the black... until sunshine and blue sky take over.
The ivy-streaked stone buildings of a busy UNIVERSITY CAMPUS.
Half-filled with STUDENTS. A PROFESSOR stands at the front, as a PICTURE OF A MIDDLE-EASTERN PROTEST is projected on a massive screen. Mobs of PEOPLE pack the street.

In this one image, we can see the pain on the faces. The blood on clothing... in the street. (turns to the Students) So where is the observer? Obviously, heвЂ™s taking the photograph, but is the observer also in the photograph? (points to the students) Anna. There among the other Students is ANNA, (20), grown into a beautiful young woman, with a spark in her eyes. She studies the photograph a moment, then...  10.
Yes. The Observer is in it.
Why?
The focus is on the fear... the faces of the protesters... their struggle. But the police, the soldiers... theyвЂ™re all blurred... almost secondary. This isnвЂ™t their story.

Exactly. A GIRL, (CHRISTINE), a few seats down from Anna playfully rolls her eyes... throws a crumpled wad of paper at her. PROFESSOR (cont'd) The observerвЂ™s bias, right or wrong, is held within the image. ItвЂ™s what he wants us to see. The Professor hits a button... the photograph changes to another image from the same riot... a Soldier helping a fallen Woman. PROFESSOR (cont'd) Werner Heisenberg calls it the uncertainty principle. That the observer always affects the observation. ANGLE ON ANNA... ...as she eyes the photograph. PROFESSOR (0.S.) (cont'd) If you shine a light on something to see it, you have by that action changed what you are looking at. (beat ) So in many ways, we see what we want to see.  11.
Anna walks across the quad with a group of GIRLS... laughing and talking. Christine leads the way.
All that вЂњIs the observer in the picture or not shitвЂќ... itвЂ™s like some kinda mind-fuck WhereвЂ™s Waldo game or something.
Because youвЂ™ve only been to about half the classes this semester.
And the day after exams, IвЂ™1l fuck Professor Finchem, and weвЂ™1l both get AвЂ™s. What took you twelve weeks of work will take me twelve minutes. The laughing gets louder.
God, Christine, youвЂ™re such a little whore.
And I heard Finchem is more like seven minutes.

Even better. Gives me time to work on my biology grade too. Anna laughs... then sees something in the distance, and her smile fades. She doesnвЂ™t know it, but she stopped walking. And then we see what Anna saw... a GIRL, (20), a long coat hanging over her small frame. SheвЂ™s too far away to make out any features. But Anna obviously recognizes her. The other girls stop... look back at Anna.
WhatвЂ™s wrong?
IвЂ™1l catch up.  12. The Girl follows AnnaвЂ™s stare... spots the Figure.

WhoвЂ™s that? AnnaвЂ™s already walking away. The Girls shrug... continue on. Anna makes her way across the Quad... toward the Figure, still standing in the distance. And as Anna moves closer, the FigureвЂ™s features come into focus... and itвЂ™s clearly LUCIE... dark eyes tucked in a hard face... sheвЂ™d be pretty if she cared. But she doesnвЂ™t. Anna reaches Lucie, and neither shows any emotion... just hold a look, then...
What are you doing here, Lucie?
You used to be happy to see me.
(forces a smile) I still am. IвЂ™m just surprised. Anna gives Lucie an awkward hug. Lucie doesnвЂ™t return it.
I called. You never called back.
I meant to. IвЂ™ve just been busy with...
Life.
You say it like itвЂ™s a bad thing.
I wouldnвЂ™t know.
ThatвЂ™s your choice. I tried.  13.
Sweet Anna. Always trying to help me. Anna doesnвЂ™t want this. Not now. Not ever again.
IвЂ™m in the middle of some things so... what do you need?
I found them. AnnaвЂ™s face immediately changes... from annoyance to anger... maybe even fear.
What? Lucie just nods... you heard right. ANNA (contвЂ™d) You always think youвЂ™ve found them.
But this time IвЂ™m sure. I want to show you. Anna hesitates, then shakes her head.
I canвЂ™t.
Why? A BEAT, then...
Life. I chose to live it.
So can I. Once you see. Once you believe me. I can make it all go away.
ItвЂ™s been too long. They arenвЂ™t out there... not anymore.
ItвЂ™s them. I know it.  14.
It isnвЂ™t them. ItвЂ™s a face you think you remember... just like all the other faces you were so sure of.
ItвЂ™s different this time. Anna and Lucie hold a long look, then...
IвЂ™m sorry. ...and Anna turns... starts back across the grounds.
Anna. Nothing. LUCIE (contвЂ™d)
Anna only speeds up her pace, until sheвЂ™s trotting back after her friends... leaving Lucie as far behind her as she can.
Music and noise raging. The MOB OF STUDENTS has overflowed into the front yard.

Music... beer... laughter. Except for Anna, standing at a window, looking out at the dark quad. She looks much like Lucie did that first day at the orphanage... searching for something while the rest of the world lives. MARCUS, (21), good-looking Frat Boy, moves up behind her... wraps his arm around her waist... holds a plastic cup to her lips, but Anna leans her head away from it.
WhatвЂ™s wrong?  15.
I just donвЂ™t feel so great tonight. Marcus leans in... kisses her neck.
You wanna come over to my place? We can just hang out. Anna turns... gives him a soft kiss, then...

IвЂ™1l call you later. Anna pulls away... makes her way to the door. Gone. INT. DORM/ANNAвЂ™S ROOM - NIGHT Anna lies in bed, staring at the ceiling. In the dim light, she doesnвЂ™t look that different than twenty years ago. Suddenly, thereвЂ™s a SCREAM... just like LucieвЂ™s scream. Anna leaps from the bed.

Anna races into the hall... ... where she sees itвЂ™s just a BOY carrying a LAUGHING GIRL over his shoulder. The Girl SCREAMS again. Anna watches them disappear into a room. INT. DORM/ANNAвЂ™S ROOM - NIGHT Anna walks back in... sits on the edge of her bed then opens a nightstand drawer... digs under all the layers of junk... to a life shoved away... ...pulls out PHOTOGRAPHS OF ANNA AND LUCIE WHEN THEY WERE LITTLE GIRLS... laughing together... making faces... the best of friends. Anna stares at the photographs. A tear slips down her cheek.  16. INT. DORM/ANNAвЂ™S ROOM - MORNING Anna asleep. Just in front of her, a CELL PHONE rests on a nightstand beside the old photographs. The phone VIBRATES... stops... VIBRATES again... loud enough to stir Anna awake. Her eyes try to open... canвЂ™t. She reaches blind for the phone... answers.
Hello?
I need you to believe me. LucieвЂ™s voice opens AnnaвЂ™s eyes. LUCIE (V.0.) (cont'd) I need you to see them too. Anna just lies there a moment, then...
Tell me where you are.

ANGLE ON A MAILBOX... the numbers 497 tacked to the side. We PULL BACK from the mailbox... ...to a beat-up, old Honda Civic sitting along the edge of a dirt road. LucieвЂ™s behind the wheel, staring at the FARMHOUSE in the distance... a wide cornfield beside it. She looks beyond the house... ...to a MAN, (50's), working on a tractor in the backyard.

The Man steps off the tractor... looks at the massive sinkhole in front of him... ...ten feet deep by six feet wide... a collapsed tree at the center. The Man climbs down into the hole... starts tearing at one of the muddy walls with a shovel.  17. We can make out the METAL RING OF A LARGE DRAINAGE PIPE. HeвЂ™s trying to clear it.

Large and open... a CRUCIFIX hangs on a wall along with FAMILY PHOTOS. Newspaper articles hang on the refrigerator door... a TEEN GIRL WINNING A SWIM MEET... a TEEN BOY HOLDING A SOCCER TROPHY. Then we see the Two Teens at the table, the BOY, (17) and GIRL, (15), slurping back cereal, as their MOTHER, (50's), fries some bacon on the stove.
WhatвЂ™s the plan for today? (off their shrugs) Well I need your rooms cleaned before anyone goes anywhere.
IвЂ™m supposed to pick Katie up in an hour.
I just looked at your room... you better call and tell her youвЂ™re going to be late. Real late. The Boy GROANS.
I thought she broke up with you.
Nobody breaks up with me.
I donвЂ™t think Katie knows that Neither does the guy she was slobbering on at the lake last night. The Girl grins... she loves messing with big brother
You're full of shit.
Hey.  18.
He says it all the time. The Man from the hole enters through the back door.
Not in front of me he doesnвЂ™t.
WhatвЂ™s not in front of you?
Nothing.
Brandon said I was full of shit.
HeвЂ™s probably right. The Boy chuckles... the Girl flips the Boy off. The Man pulls a slice of bacon off the counter... the Mother gives his hand a smack.
Wash your hands. The Man glances at his hands... filthy.
A surgeonвЂ™s hands should never get this dirty. He presses a palm against the MotherвЂ™s ass... leaves a HANDPRINT ON HER PANTS before going to the sink
Randall!
(to the Boy) After breakfast IвЂ™m going to need you to help me downstairs.
Mom said I had to clean my room.
Soon as weвЂ™re done. The Boy GROANS again... not the way he wanted his day to start.  19.
Why doesnвЂ™t Nicole ever have to help down there? The 0.S. RING OF THE DOORBELL. The Man starts out of the room toward it.
Because I love her more. The Girl flicks a piece of cereal at the Boy.
The Man reaches the door... pulls it open... ...and thereвЂ™s Lucie in that long coat of hers.

Can I... Before he can finish, Lucie has a SHOTGUN PULLED FROM BENEATH THAT COAT. Ina flash, itвЂ™s leveled at the ManвЂ™s chest... ...BOOM... ...like the Man was hit by a truck. His body flies back into a mirror, shattering it. The glass rains down on top of the bloody corpse.

Randall!? The Woman comes racing into the entry... as Lucie steps inside. The Woman sees Lucie and her husbandвЂ™s corpse at the same moment... is frozen... ...BOOM... LucieвЂ™s shot hits her in the stomach. The Woman twists to the floor. And now the kids are both SCREAMING... leaning out to see whatвЂ™s left of their parents... ...as Lucie steps over the bodies... walks toward the kids, reloading her shotgun as she moves.
The Girl takes off down the hall... the Boy back into the kitchen.  20.
The Boy hurries to the counter... grabs a KNIFE... spins... ...and thereвЂ™s Lucie standing in the doorway, shotgun raised.

Sit down. The Boy doesnвЂ™t move... is weighing his chances against that shotgun... finally realizes they arenвЂ™t good, and sits at the table. LUCIE (contвЂ™d) How old are you? The Boy is too scared to answer. LUCIE (contвЂ™d)
Seventeen. Lucie considers that... doing the math in her head.

Did you know about the things your parents did? The Boy looks confused... manages a shrug. And that must be good enough for Lucie, because she lowers the gun... just stares at the Boy a beat... ... before swinging it back up again.

The Girl stands against the closed door. The 0.S. GUNSHOT sends her body into convulsions... ...she backs away from the door, crying... ...Sspins to the bed... dives to the floor, and crawls under.  21. ANGLE ON THE GIRL... ... hiding beneath the bed... a hand over her mouth trying to stifle the crying. From outside the room, we can hear doors being opened... footsteps moving closer THE GIRLвЂ™S POV... as the door suddenly swings open... LucieвЂ™s feet step inside, along the with tip of that shotgun barrel almost dragging the floor The Girl tries not to breathe... watches LucieвЂ™s feet move past the bed. She finally closes her eyes. LUCIE - STANDING JUST BESIDE THE BED... ...Staring at it... finally stepping up onto the mattress... aiming the barrel down into the bed. And LucieвЂ™s CRYING NOW TOO... she doesnвЂ™t want to do this... doesnвЂ™t want to kill anyone else, but she canвЂ™t stop... not now... ...BOOM... ...feathers explode from the comforter... float around the room like snowflakes. And everythingвЂ™s silent... .В»..as a PUDDLE OF BLOOD OOZES OUT FROM UNDER THE BED. Lucie drops to her knees on the bed... breaks down... whatever brought her here is over.
IвЂ™m sorry... IвЂ™m sorry... IвЂ™m sorry.
Lucie kneels over the lifeless Woman... strokes her face with bloodsoaked hands.

Why did you do those things to me? Why? Tell me!  22. Lucie begins shaking the Woman... as if sheвЂ™s trying to awaken her. LUCIE (contвЂ™d) How could you? HOW COULD YOU?! Lucie finally stops shaking her... just drops back against the wall, looking at the bodies. LUCIE (contвЂ™d) I was just a little girl.

AnnaвЂ™s car pulls up alongside the mailbox... those same numbers... 497... and LucieвЂ™s car sitting off in the grass. INT. ANNAвЂ™S CAR - DAY Anna pulls out her CELL PHONE... starts to dial, then stops... NO SIGNAL.

Anna climbs out of her car... holds the phone out... turns in a circle, looking for some flash of life... nothing. So she looks to that farmhouse... hesitates a beat then tosses the phone back into her car, and starts walking up the drive.
Anna crosses the yard... through the picket gate... up the walk... ...and slows when she sees the front door standing open. She doesnвЂ™t like the feel of this. Anna stops... looks around.

Lucie? No answer.  23. ANNA (contвЂ™d) (toward the door) Hello? Nothing. So Anna starts moving again... up the front stairs... ...the view inside the door rising with each step she climbs... ...until the MANвЂ™S BLOODSOAKED LEGS COME INTO FOCUS, twisted on the entry floor. ANNA (contвЂ™d) Oh, God. Anna begins to tremble... trips a little on the top step... stares in the door at the Man... ...the Mother lying beyond him.
I didnвЂ™t have a choice. Anna spins with a start... sees Lucie standing on the walk behind her... blood spattered across her face... that shotgun still in her hands. AnnaвЂ™s scared out of her mind.
Lucie... what did you do?
What I had to. I told you it was them.
No... you were going to show them to me. We were going to tell the police.

The police wouldnвЂ™t have believed us. You know that. They donвЂ™t care anymore. No one cares anymore. Lucie starts up the steps toward Anna... as Anna eyes that shotgun moving closer. LUCIE (contвЂ™d) Except you and I, Anna.  24. Lucie gently takes AnnaвЂ™s hand in hers. Anna stiffens at the touch... lets Lucie guide her into the house. LUCIE (contвЂ™d) I want you to see... so youвЂ™1l believe me.
Anna and Lucie stand over the ManвЂ™s bloody corpse... his lifeless eyes frozen in a final stare.

ItвЂ™s him. His face has changed a little, but the eyes... I know those eyes. Anna canвЂ™t control herself any longer... vomits. LUCIE (contвЂ™d) HeвЂ™s the one, Anna. (pointing to the Mother ) And her. Anna just shakes her head... backs up against the wall.
ItвЂ™s been too long. You donвЂ™t... (beat ) You canвЂ™t be sure.
Not sure enough to do this.
ITвЂ™S THEM! (calms herself) Why donвЂ™t you believe me? Anna moves deeper into the house... sees the DEAD BOY CRUMPLED IN THE CHAIR... she GASPS IN HORROR. LUCIE (contвЂ™d) They knew.  25.
They?
The children.
There are more?
A girl.
Oh, God. Lucie...
They knew what their parents were doing. Anna shakes her head...
No... no. Anna canвЂ™t take anymore... starts for the door... fast. Lucie grabs her.
Anna, wait. You have to believe me. Anna keeps moving... almost running now... just trying to get out of this house... away from all this death. Lucie follows after her.
Anna charges down the porch steps. Lucie runs out of the door behind her.
Anna! PLEASE! Anna stops... turns back to Lucie.
I canвЂ™t help you anymore. LucieвЂ™s eyes fill with tears. This is the end, and she knows it.  26.

Please... Anna shakes her head... turns and starts down the walk... back toward the road. Lucie collapses to the steps... just sits there, watching Anna leave her. ANGLE ON LUCIE... ...the front doorway just behind her. And we HOLD ON LUCIE a long beat... the sadness in her eyes... ...when SUDDENLY A SHAPE DARTS THROUGH THE SHADOWS INSIDE THE HOUSE... too fast for us to see what it was. Then the CRASH OF A VASE SHATTERING spins Lucie to the doorway... she looks in... confused... maybe frightened. Who did she miss?

Lucie eases down the hall... stops in the living room, where the SHARDS OF A BROKEN VASE are scattered on the floor. Lucie stares at the pieces... as she reaches into her coat pocket... pulls out TWO SHOTGUN SHELLS... opens to gun... slides them in, then SNAPS the gun back into position... ...just as the CEILING CREAKS ABOVE HER... FOOTSTEPS.
Lucie slowly climbs the stairs, that shotgun ready to fire.
AnnaвЂ™s crying... walking toward the road... toward her escape.  27.

Lucie inches down the hall... glancing in each open doorway she passes. And weвЂ™re just waiting for something to spring out of one, but they donвЂ™t... and Lucie keeps walking... ...Until a DOOR SLAMS SHUT BEHIND HER. She turns... stares at it a beat, then charges... fast... reaches the door, and kicks it open... gun raised to finish off whoeverвЂ™s behind it. The door swings wide... ...and thereвЂ™s that SAME MONSTROUS CREATURE WE FIRST SAW ON LUCIEвЂ™S BED TEN YEARS AGO... what could be a WOMAN... ...long, black hair matted over a bony, skeletal frame. But we donвЂ™t get a clear look before the CREATURE SPRINGS AT LUCIE... knocking her back... ...LucieвЂ™s finger instinctively SQUEEZES THE TRIGGER... BOOM... but the shot fires harmlessly into the ceiling as she falls.
Anna turns to the gunshot... watches as a CLOUD OF BIRDS EXPLODE FROM THE TREES.

Lucie sails backward through the railing, with the Creature on top of her... tearing at her... they hit the stairs... CRACK... tumble down in a blur Lucie SLAMS to the bottom with a THUD... loses her gun. The Creature SCREECHES OUT... leaps again, but Lucie kicks it away... scrambles up... trips over the MotherвЂ™s body... her hands drip with the MotherвЂ™s blood, as she races away.  28.
Lucie tears into the kitchen... grabs the KNIFE that the Boy once held on her... turns... waits for the next attack.
Wait... please... She holds up the bloody hand. LUCIE (contвЂ™d) ...I did it. ItвЂ™s over. The 0.S. SMACKING OF RUNNING FEET. Lucie keeps that hand held up as she walks into the hall.
Lucie moves along the hall, her hand leading the way.

I stopped them. Then a GURGLING BEHIND LUCIE... she freezes... doesnвЂ™t want to see whatвЂ™s there, but knows she has to... so she slowly turns... В»..to that CREATURE CROUCHED ON THE FLOOR. LUCIE (contвЂ™d) See... I stopped th... The Creature leaps... tackles Lucie. And Lucie does her best to fight the Creature off, but itвЂ™s too strong... tears the knife from LucieвЂ™s hand... starts slicing it wildly across LucieвЂ™s chest... down her arms. LucieвЂ™s SCREAMING... fighting for her life... finally breaks free again... drags herself into a doorway.

Lucie slams the door shut... starts to back away, then hears TAPPING BEHIND HER.  29. She turns... looks across the room to a METAL CHAIR that looks just like the ones from her childhood drawings... ...and this one has the YOUNG LUCIE is sitting in it... trying to pull free... lifting one of those loose, bolted legs up... TAP as it hits the floor again. And then a SHADOWY FIGURE walks past the Young Lucie... stands in front of her. We canвЂ™t see the FigureвЂ™s face, but just as the Young Lucie is about to scream, the Figure SWINGS HIS HAND TOWARD HER MOUTH...

head_text.subj: OUR LUCIE... THROWING HER OWN HAND OVER HER MOUTH...

text: В»..as she slides down into the corner... and we realize this is just a closet... there is no metal chair... no Figure... no Young Lucie. Then a SQUEAK, as the DOORKNOB BEGINS TO TURN... ...and Lucie canвЂ™t do anything but watch it... wait for the Creature to come inside and kill her The door inches open... but it isnвЂ™t the Creature... itвЂ™s Anna... come to save Lucie again. Lucie looks up at Anna, just the way she did when she was a little girl.

ItвЂ™s here, Anna. Anna nods... drops down beside Lucie, and pulls the door back closed again. LUCIE (contвЂ™d) It hurt me again. Anna wraps her arm around Lucie... holds her just the way she used to... and EASES THE BLOODY KNIFE FROM LUCIEвЂ™S HAND.
ItвЂ™s okay. IвЂ™ve got you. I wonвЂ™t let anything hurt you.  30. Lucie buries her face to AnnaвЂ™s chest. Anna gently rocks her... larger versions of those two little girls years ago.
Lucie soaks in a tub, as Anna carefully cleans the knife wounds across her chest. OLD JAGGED SCARS COVER LUCIEвЂ™S ARMS AND LEGS... a lifetime of pain.
You need a doctor. I donвЂ™t know how to do this. Lucie isnвЂ™t worried about her wounds... sheвЂ™s almost smiling.
You should have seen his face when he opened the door. He recognized me too. I could see it in his eyes.
If it was really him.
It was him. (beat ) I just wish I could have made it last longer. Watched them suffer the way they watched me. Anna doesnвЂ™t want to talk about this.
We need to hurry... finda hospital... someplace far away.
After we get rid of the bodies... clean the house back up.
We donвЂ™t have time.
ThatвЂ™s the only way it will leave me alone. I have to wipe them away... like they never existed. (MORE)
(beat)UCIE(cont 'd) Then it will have to let me go. Anna hesitates... eyes LucieвЂ™s face... sheвЂ™s so sure. Anna nods... stands... starts out.
IвЂ™m going to find you some clothes. Lucie rests in the tub... raises her hand up above her... studies it... itвЂ™s covered in scars zig- zagging all over her skin.
ItвЂ™s almost over.

Anna pulls a t-shirt from a dresser drawer... adds it to the pants she already has in her hands. She starts out of the room... stops in the doorway, and looks back... ...to that puddle of blood seeping out from under the bed... ...the hint of the GirlвЂ™s foot tucked beneath in the shadows. Anna stares at it a moment, then turns... ...RIGHT INTO LUCIE... her naked body dripping wet. Anna jumps with a start.
Jesus.
Sorry. Anna hands the clothes to Lucie.
IвЂ™1l meet you in there. Lucie watches Anna walk away.  32.

Anna enters... just stands there a moment before she spots the SHOTGUN on the floor. She throws a glance back out of the room, then grabs the shotgun... shoves it under the couch... ...scoops up the scattered shotgun shells... rolls them under... then backs away, just as Lucie walks in.
You ready?
Yeah.

head_text.subj: THE FACE OF THE DEAD MAN...

text: ...then we see Lucie, dressed in the borrowed t-shirt and jeans, is holding his outstretched arms... AnnaвЂ™s got his feet... ready to drag him out the door But AnnaвЂ™s caught in a stare... canвЂ™t help.

WhatвЂ™s wrong? Anna doesnвЂ™t answer. So Lucie drops his hands... moves around, snatching AnnaвЂ™s arm... jerking her down... close to the ManвЂ™s face. LUCIE (contвЂ™d) Can you smell it? Anna pulls away from Lucie.
Lucie, stop.

Can you? Anna backs away from the body... away from Lucie.  33. LUCIE (contвЂ™d) IвЂ™ve known that smell my whole life. From every time he'd beat me. Every time heвЂ™d walk into my cell. HeвЂ™d tell me how perfect I was... how I was the one theyвЂ™d all been waiting for. (beat ) And then heвЂ™d pull out the chains. Lucie stands... moves back around, grabbing the ManвЂ™s hands. LUCIE (contвЂ™d) DonвЂ™t let what he looks like now make you feel sorry for him. Lucie waits for Anna to lift the ManвЂ™s feet. Finally, Anna does... they drag the Man out the door.

head_text.subj: THAT HOLE THE MAN WAS WORKING IN...

text: ...as his body suddenly rolls in... tumbles to the bottom. Anna and Lucie stand at the top of the hole, staring down at the corpse until...

We need to get the others. Lucie walks away. Anna stands there a moment... looks up... to the distance... ...her car still parked along that dirt road. She could run now if she wanted... run and leave all this behind... ...but instead she turns... follows Lucie back into the house... ...and weвЂ™re left alone, staring down at that corpse at the bottom of the hole.  34.
Anna and Lucie stand over the body of the Boy, still slumped in that chair Lucie pulls him over... he falls to the floor... SPLAT... his dead eyes staring up at Anna.
Why donвЂ™t we just leave? Someone will find them... take them out.

I told you. I have to do it. Anna shakes her head... begins to tear up. LUCIE (contвЂ™d) A little boy used to watch them... the things theyвЂ™d do to me. Lucie stares down at the dead BoyвЂ™s face. SheвЂ™s emotionless. LUCIE (contвЂ™d) Find a sheet if that makes it easier for you.
Anna tears back the covers from a bed.
The sun is gone, replaced by a darkening sky, and heavy rain. Anna and Lucie carry the sheet-wrapped body across the yard.
ANGLE ON THE MANвЂ™S TWISTED CORPSE... ...asS RAIN PELTS IT.  35.

head_text.subj: THEN THE SHEET-WRAPPED BODY ROLLS DOWN THE SIDE OF

text: THE HOLE... falls across the ManвЂ™s... the BOYвЂ™S FACE flops out, uncovered.
Anna and Lucie stare down from the edge of the hole. Lucie looks to the CRIMSON STAINS BLEEDING THROUGH HER T-SHIRT, then raises her gaze to the sky... the rain beats across her face.

IвЂ™m so tired. Lucie glances back to the Farmhouse... to an upstairs window, where the silhouette of a LONG-HAIRED FIGURE peers out at her. LUCIE (contвЂ™d) Do you think it will let me rest? Just for a little while? Anna follows LucieвЂ™s stare... up to the empty window.
Yes.
Lucie sleeps on the shredded, feather-covered bed.
AnnaвЂ™s at the sink... running water over her face... trying not to be sick. She raises up... stares at her reflection in the mirror.

Anna walks into the room... glances around. Her eyes settle on a shelf of FRAMED PHOTOGRAPHS... ...various shots of the family through the years... smiling and laughing together.  36. They look completely normal... the perfect family. Not a pack of sadistic torturers. Anna pulls down one of the pictures... sits on the couch, and just stares at it... those faces so full of life. Her eyes slowly rise from the photo... to a table... a PHONE resting there... waiting for Anna to just pick it up. Anna gazes at the phone... then glances to the hall... no sign of Lucie... back to that phone again. Finally, Anna stands... walks to the phone... another look to the hall before she picks it up... ...we can hear the V.O. DIAL TONE. Anna stares at the receiver a beat... until her trembling finger hits the вЂњ9вЂќ... BEEP... ...she throws a quick glance over her shoulder to the empty hall... ...back to the phone... вЂњ1вЂќ... BEEP... ...her finger hovers over the button... knows what that final push means.

head_text.subj: BEHIND ANNA... MOVING THROUGH THE DOORWAY

text: ...Silently closing in.
...Staring at that вЂњ1вЂќ.
...almost close enough to touch her

...glancing behind her... ...but the roomвЂ™s empty... ...S0 Anna makes her choice... presses that вЂњ1вЂќ... BEEP... ...just as thereвЂ™s an 0.S. THUMP FROM THE HALLWAY... ...S0 Anna quickly HANGS UP THE PHONE... turns... waits... ANOTHER THUMP.

Lucie? No answer. But thereвЂ™s definitely someone moving out in that hall... ...S0 Anna eases across the living room... toward the doorway. ANNA (contвЂ™d) Lucie, are you awake? Still nothing. Anna steps out into the hall, and weвЂ™re ready for Lucie or some Creature to leap on Anna, but thereвЂ™s no one... ...just the body of the Mother still sprawled on the floor. Anna turns... scans the other direction... THUMP from behind her... she spins back around... ...Still no one. And then she sees the MOTHER MOVE... somehow... her body arch... her foot twist into the wall... THUMP. Jesus, sheвЂ™s alive. And Anna doesnвЂ™t know what to do... just stands frozen, staring... ...as the Mother GASPS... her eyes flutter open... she reaches a bloody hand out to Anna.  38.

Please... Anna still only stares back in shock... then looks beyond her to the darkened doorway where Lucie sleeps... if sheвЂ™s still asleep. Then Anna bursts into action... hurries to the Mother... huddles over her
(whispering) You have to be quiet.
Help me. Anna throws her hand over the MotherвЂ™s lips.

I will, but you have to be quiet. Anna begins to lift the Mother up... she CRIES OUT IN PAIN. ANNA (contвЂ™d) SHHHH... please. SheвЂ™1l hear us. Anna throws a nervous glance to LucieвЂ™s doorway... no sign of her yet. So Anna keeps lifting... ...until the Mother is standing on her rubbery legs... an arm wrapped around AnnaвЂ™s neck.
My children.
Quiet.
Where are they?
IвЂ™m taking you to them. You just have to stop talking. Anna and the Mother make their way down the hall... to the front door... ...as Anna looks behind them again... still no Lucie.  39.
Anna drags the Mother down the front walk.
Call the police. Please.
I have a car. IвЂ™m going to take you. We just have to hurry.
I canвЂ™t leave my family.

You arenвЂ™t leaving them. wWeвЂ™re going to... Then a NOISE FROM INSIDE THE HOUSE... a DOOR SLAMMING. Anna spins to it. No one there. Anna pulls the Mother into the shadows... bushes... hiding from whoever is about to rush out of that front door. Hiding from Lucie.
I want to see my children.
(angry whisper) Shut up.
...my little girl. Anna clamps her hand over the MotherвЂ™s mouth.

(whispers) SheвЂ™11 kill you if you donвЂ™t stay quiet. Anna holds her hand across the MotherвЂ™s lips, as she stares through the bushes to the door... ...Still no sign of Lucie. And itвЂ™s long enough that we start to think everythingвЂ™s going to be fine. But then a CLICK from behind them... a TWIG SNAPPING...  40. ...and as Anna turns to it... ...LUCIE LEAPS FROM THE SHADOWS... ...SWinging that knife... slamming it down into the MotherвЂ™s back. The Mother CRIES OUT. Anna falls away. ANNA (contвЂ™d)

Lucie raises the knife again... THWACK... the Mother SCREAMS... THWACK... SCREAMS AGAIN... ...as Anna reaches in to help her, but Lucie knocks her away... THWACK... the blade drives down again. The MotherвЂ™s dead. Lucie stares down at the corpse... pulls the knife out, and turns her gaze to Anna.
Why?
I was just...
Why did you help her?
She didnвЂ™t deserve to die. She didnвЂ™t do anything wrong.
What about all the things she did to me? I told you. Lucie moves toward Anna. LUCIE (contвЂ™d)
Anna starts crawling away... back toward the house. And LucieвЂ™s following after her, that knife still gripped in her bloody fist.  41. LUCIE (contвЂ™d) But you wanted her to live? Instead of me?
No.
Then why try to save her? Why try to let her do it all again?
She wouldnвЂ™t have hurt you. I wouldnвЂ™t have let her.

YouвЂ™re lying! And then Lucie stops walking. The rage vanishes from her face, as sadness replaces it LUCIE (contвЂ™d) You never believed me. (beat ) You think IвЂ™m crazy... just like all the doctors.
No, Lucie. But itвЂ™s true, and Anna knows it... so does Lucie. ThatвЂ™s why the tears fill her eyes. The knife slips from her fingers... to the ground at her feet.
I thought once you saw, you'd believe. That once I showed you their faces, you could love me again. AnnaвЂ™s too frightened to speak... just watches Lucie walk past, back into the house.
Lucie. Lucie! But Lucie keeps walking.  42.
Lucie starts down the hall... looks to the smeared blood on the floor and walls. We hear V.0. SCREAMS.
OUR POV gliding down a dark, empty hallway... those SCREAMS ARE LOUDER.
As Lucie walks past... the blood spattered walls where she killed the Boy. She gazes at the CRUCIFIX as she passes, and we hear THOSE SAME V.0O. SCREAMS.
As we push through the shadows... to a tiny, windowless room... ...a SMALL FIGURE sits chained to a chair at the center. A rusty bucket rests beneath the chair
As Lucie steps into a puddle of blood... tracks it across the living room floor.
As we float around to the front of the Small Figure, staring directly at us...  43. ...the YOUNG LUCIE.
Please. No...
Lucie sitting on the couch, staring at us just as her younger self was. A FRAMED FAMILY PHOTOGRAPH of the victims rests in her lap.

...more. Please. And then we see who LucieвЂ™s talking to... ...that Creature... its horrible, twisted shape huddled on the floor in front of her. LUCIE (contвЂ™d) IвЂ™m so tired. The Creature GURGLES... its eyes peering through that long, tangled hair. Then it begins crawling toward Lucie... its movements twitchy and broken... ...Slowly dragging its form over the floor, until itвЂ™s just in front of Lucie. It reaches out... almost embracing her... running its mangled, scarred hands across LucieвЂ™s... easing the photograph from LucieвЂ™s lap... ...and as the Creature holds Lucie, she SMASHES THE PHOTOGRAPH ACROSS LUCIEвЂ™S HEAD. Lucie SCREAMS OUT.
Anna looks up to LucieвЂ™s cry... scrambles toward it.
Lucie!

As the Creature grabs a shard of the broken glass... slices it down LucieвЂ™s leg. Lucie SCREAMS AGAIN... but doesnвЂ™t fight the Creature off... just allows the torture... В»..as the Creature THRUSTS THE SHARD INTO LUCIEвЂ™S OTHER LEG... ...takes LucieвЂ™s head in her hands, and begins SLAMMING IT AGAINST THE WALL... WHAM... WHAM... ...and Lucie is CRYING, but still powerless to stop her... ...as Anna rushes in behind Lucie... ...sees Lucie ALONE IN THE LIVING ROOM... HER OWN

head_text.subj: HANDS GRIPPING HER HEAD... SLAMMING IT AGAINST THE

text: WALL OVER AND OVER... CRYING OUT with each punishing blow.
Please! No! But the abuse continues... Lucie JAMS THE GLASS INTO HER OWN LEG AGAIN... ...SCREAMS in pain.

Lucie, stop! Anna charges Lucie... grabs her arm just as sheвЂ™s about to stab herself again. Lucie tries to fight Anna off... raises the glass to stab Anna... then recognizes her... finally calms... ... their eyes meet... ANNA (contвЂ™d) No more, Lucie. No more. ...and itвЂ™s as if Lucie is awakening from a dream. A calmness washes over her... the shard of bloody glass slips from her grasp. ANNA (contвЂ™d) ItвЂ™s gone.  45.
ItвЂ™s never going to let me go. Then suddenly Lucie breaks free... races straight for the picture window... doesnвЂ™t slow down as she blasts through.
Lucie explodes through the window... the glass rains down as she sails out... drops the twenty feet to the ground... ...-hits with a violent THUD. And doesnвЂ™t move. Anna peers down from the window.
Lucie! Nothing. ANNA (contвЂ™d)
Anna spins... races outside.
Anna sprints across the yard... drops to her knees beside Lucie... rolls her over LucieвЂ™s unconscious... and a bloody mess.
Please, Lucie... no. Anna strokes LucieвЂ™s face... kisses her ANNA (contвЂ™d) DonвЂ™t leave me. Lucie GASPS... COUGHS UP BLOOD... sheвЂ™s still alive. Anna lifts Lucie into her arms.  46.

The BoyвЂ™s room. Soccer posters on the wall... a few trophies on a shelf... a PROM PICTURE of the Boy and his GIRLFRIEND. But right now, LucieвЂ™s asleep in his bed, wearing just that wet, stained t-shirt. AnnaвЂ™s wrapped the wounds on her legs. She sits there, gently stroking LucieвЂ™s hair... her face.
Beside the orphanage. The young Anna and Lucie race around the meadow, SINGING as they chase butterflies down a slope...
This old man, he plays ten...
...he plays knick-knack once again...

...with a knick-knack paddywhack give the dog a bone. This old man went rolling home. And as they sing that last line, the girls tumble to the ground... roll down the gentle slope, LAUGHING... ...finally fall still at the bottom... lay there side by side in the high grass. They gaze up at the sky... the clouds floating above them.
I wish I could ride a cloud. Let it take me wherever I wanted.
Where would you want to go? Lucie hesitates... this is an important question... it deserves some real thought. Then...  47.
Wherever you go. The little girls exchange a smile... their hands meet between them... fingers clasped. Friends for life.

Anna trudges through the pouring rain, carrying the GirlвЂ™s body... reaches the hole, and eases her down. The Girl slides along the muddy wall... tumbles to the bottom beside her Mother. The family is all together again.
AnnaвЂ™s filling a garbage bag with bloody rags.
Anna carries the garbage bag down the steps... reaches the bottom, and looks across the floor... В»..So much blood.

AnnaвЂ™s on her hands and knees, wiping up the blood from the floor... turning a white towel crimson tossing it into the trash bag, then grabbing another. As she scrubs, the PHONE RINGS. Anna freezes... listens as it RINGS AGAIN... holds her breath as if whoeverвЂ™s calling might hear her... RING... then a CLICK, and...

YouвЂ™ve reached the Pattersons. Sorry we canвЂ™t get to the phone, weвЂ™re probably just doing something much more important. Anna looks at the towel in her hands... covered in the ManвЂ™s blood, as she listens to his voice. Then a BEEP...  48. ...but no voice on the other end... just silence... until another CLICK, and a DIAL TONE takes over... finally silences. Anna goes back to work.

AnnaвЂ™s cleaning up where the Boy was killed... now working with a roll of paper towels... slopping the blood up. She tears off the last shred of towel... just that cardboard tube left. She tosses it away... starts her search for more... ...opening cabinets... drawers... nothing.

Anna searches the room for towels... picks up some folded t-shirts... theyвЂ™1l work. She opens a large cabinet door... sees a mop leaning against the back wall of the cabinet. Anna grabs the mop, and the BACK WALL MOVES. Anna notices... sees a handle... pulls the wall open... because it isnвЂ™t a wall, itвЂ™s a door. Anna squints into the darkness beyond... reaches deeper... finds a light switch... CLICK... ...@ row of FLUORESCENT TUBES flicker on, leading down a narrow, cement stairway. AnnaвЂ™s suddenly curious... nervous even... drops the makeshift rags on the floor, and steps into the hidden passage... ...doesnвЂ™t see the small red bulb above the doorway that begins BLINKING.

Anna makes her way down the steps...  49. ...reaches the dark bottom... finds another switch... CLICK... more fluorescent tubes sizzle on... one by one down the length of a long hall. And thereвЂ™s nothing musty or filthy about this place... itвЂ™s clean... sterile. Like something you might find in a hospital. Anna stands there a moment... not sure she wants to see whatвЂ™s down here. But her legs arenвЂ™t listening to her brain... start walking on their own... carrying her slowly down the hallway... her footsteps echoing... ...reaching LARGE PHOTOGRAPHS along the walls... gruesome surgical photos... a YOUNG WOMAN WITH STITCHES SURROUNDING HER NECK, as if her head has been sewn onto her body. The Young WomanвЂ™s eyes are wide open... gazing upward... ...,another WOMAN lying on a operating table... her intestines pouring out of her open stomach... and her EYES OPEN WIDE... GAZING UPWARD... ...an OLD WOMAN hanging from a wall... hundreds of hooks through her skin... wires attached, suspending her in the air. And just like the others, her EYES ARE ROLLED UPWARD. Anna continues past the images... down the hall until she sees a LOCKED TRAP DOOR in the floor... she pulls on it... locked. She glances around... finds a RING OF KEYS... works her way through the various shapes until one fits... CLICK... the lock pops open. Anna removes it... pulls open the hatch... LIGHTS AUTOMATICALLY FLICKER ON BELOW. ThereвЂ™s a metal ladder leading down into the belly of the beast. Anna takes a breath, then climbs down the ladder.

Anna descends the ladder... reaches the bottom... another cement hallway.  50. She walks to the end... through plastic curtains hanging across the hall... ...into OPEN SHOWER AREAS... keeps walking... ...down another passage. This one is lined with SEVERAL METAL DOORS ON EACH SIDE. Anna moves down the hall... stops at the first door... peers in through a small glass square in the door... ...all dark on the other side. She pulls at the handle... locked. She continues on to the next door... same thing. Anna presses her nose against the glass to peer in... too dark to see anything. She slides down to the next door... repeats the motion... everythingвЂ™s locked down here... ...S80 she glides past the last door, tugging at the handle without expecting it to open... ...BUT IT DOES. Anna freezes... stares at that door cracked open... her hand still gripping the handle... just not ready to pull it wide. She lets the door close... leans to the square of glass... tries to see in from behind the safety of beyond the door... ...but if she wants to see whatвЂ™s in here, sheвЂ™s going to have to go in... ...S0 she eases the door open.

Like a prison cell... windowless walls... a METAL CHAIR BOLTED TO THE CENTER OF THE FLOOR... just like the one Lucie drew as a child. A BUCKET sits just beneath the chair. This is a modern-day version of LucieвЂ™s nightmares.  51.

Oh, God. Because AnnaвЂ™s world has just been turned upside down... ...Lucie was right about this place... about those people. Anna sees IRON RINGS BOLTED TO THE WALLS... one of them has a LONG, THICK CHAIN hanging from it... coiled along the floor, then stretched out disappearing into the shadowy back corners of the cell. Anna runs her hand along the ring... crouches down to lift the chain.

And then heвЂ™d pull out the chains. Suddenly the CHAIN IS YANKED... the metal links tearing across her palm... ...as it uncoils... snaps taut... ...thereвЂ™s something on the other end. AnnaвЂ™s too scared to move... no idea whatвЂ™s hidden in that darkness... ...but she has to know, so she follows the chain across the cell... stepping into the shadows... ...and huddled in the corner is the skeletal figure of a WOMAN... nothing but scarred flesh and bones... long greasy hair matted across her face... she looks more monster than human... not that different than LucieвЂ™s Creature... ...except this woman has a METAL RING secured around her head, completely blinding her. The Woman cowers in the corner, emitting only GUTTURAL MOANS. AnnaвЂ™s stunned... watches the Woman press herself against the wall... as if sheвЂ™s trying to hide from whoeverвЂ™s in here with her. Anna moves closer... reaches out, gently touching the WomanвЂ™s head.  52. The Woman jerks... flails her arms to keep Anna away.

ItвЂ™s okay. IвЂ™m going to help you. And AnnaвЂ™s voice must be so different than what the WomanвЂ™s used to... she springs toward her, hugging AnnaвЂ™s legs... pleading in those animal tones. Anna sees the chain is attached to a metal belt around the WomanвЂ™s waist. ANNA (contвЂ™d) I have to find a key. Anna starts away, but the Woman clings to her. ANNA (contвЂ™d) IвЂ™m not leaving you. Anna pulls free... hurries out. The Woman CRIES OUT.
Anna runs toward the ladder. The WomanвЂ™s horrible CRIES chase after her.
Anna rises up the ladder... tears the ring of keys from the trapdoor lock... descends back into the hole.
Anna crouches beside the Woman... turns the key... the chain unlocks. The WomanвЂ™s GRUNTS grow faster... excited. Anna takes her hand.

Come with me. The Woman moves cautiously... unsure where AnnaвЂ™s leading her. She extends a spindly arm in front... feeling her way.  53. As they move out of the cell, AnnaвЂ™s foot drags across the chain... it CLANKS on the floor, and the Woman SCREAMS OUT... jerks away from Anna... throws her arms over her head to protect her from what always comes next. ANNA (contвЂ™d) ItвЂ™s okay. IвЂ™m not going to hurt you. Anna gently takes the WomanвЂ™s hand again... leads her out.
Anna guides the Woman down the corridor.
Anna steps out of the hidden door... eases the Woman out behind her. The WomanвЂ™s head snaps around like a confused animal... senses sheвЂ™s in unfamiliar territory.

You donвЂ™t have to be scared. IвЂ™m going to take you to a doctor... someone to help you. The Woman tugs at the metal ring... wants it off... Now. ANNA (contвЂ™d) Wait... stop.
